name: Tricep Dumbbell Kickback
how_to_perform:
# Tricep Dumbbell Kickback

1. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm bent and palm facing towards your body. Your upper arm should be against the small of your back.
2. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help stabilize your body throughout the exercise.

3. Extend your elbow, so that only your forearm is between your upper arm and your hand. 
   *  Hold for a moment at the top of the extension
    Lower the dumbbell behind you so that it touches the middle of your thigh and keeps your core tight to avoid swinging or arching backward.
4. Push back to the starting position slowly, squeezing your triceps muscles when they extend. Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the motion.
5. Repeat with other arm.

6. Complete desired number of repetitions in a row before taking a rest.
short_summary: The Tricep Dumbbell Kickback targets the triceps posterior part and supports strengthening and shaping of back and shoulder muscles
